alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 12:50PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coconino County through 115 PM MST... At 1250 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Two Guns to 6 miles east of Rimmy Jims to 13 miles south of Meteor Crater. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Two Guns, Angell, Rimmy Jims, Twin Arrows and Meteor Crater. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 215 and 248. State Route 87 between mile markers 313 and 333. State Route 99 between mile markers 53 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Western Mogollon Rim
